system.description:
Powerful warriors clad in chainmail (known as kawaca) and crimson kopiah. They wield guns, water-engraved shields, and swords. They make up an elite warrior-class, though not all of them are Kadungganan. Very often they are royal guardians, very close to the warlord that they serve.

(The stats provided here is for a Rank 1 encounter. Check the book for higher ranks.)
system.attacks:
Inflict Violence: Lance. Attack an enemy in range 2 with Bravery, then Slide them 1 tile. This is still a melee attack.

Gambits [[/r d4]]

1: Rush > Inflict Violence > Rush

2: Rush > Inflict Violence > Engage Kalasag [1]: Until the start of the Kawacha's next riff, they gain overwhelming defenses.

3: Rush > Water Buffalo Overwhelm [2]: Attack all enemies in an area (blast 3) with Bravery, with Overwhelming, and then taunt all enemies until the end of the Kawacha's next riff.

4: Rush > Fire Gun [2]: Attack all enemies in an area (Line 6) with Bravery+Faith, setting aflame.

traits.name: Conviction
traits.description: All Folk have a reason for fighting, and if reasoned to, can cause them to rethink combat. However, they will fight for their Conviction until it looks like all is bleak.

traits.name: Morale
traits.description: At the beginning of any Resound where there are twice as many Kadungganan than there are enemies (eg., If there are 4 Kadungganan and 2 Enemies left) all Folk enemies will Surrender, becoming Defeated.

traits.name: It's Time To Raid!
traits.description: At the beginning of a Resound, the Gatusan fighters choose a single enemy in the field as their Raid Target. All their attacks against the Raid Target gain Overwhelming. If that enemy is brought to 0 HP, all Gatusan fighters in the field can heal 2 and move 2.

traits.name: Readied Shields
traits.description: 1/Resound, when an enemy enters or leaves the Kawacha's adjacency, they may force them to stay and cancel all movement, and they cannot move voluntarily until the end of their next riff.
